website_summaries.verdict: August's Doorbell Cam is the best model we've reviewed to date and is especially appealing if you have a Smart Lock or are planning to get one. Just keep in mind that it may not fit in the same spot as your old doorbell.
pros: The $199 August Doorbell Cam has on-demand live streaming and a 1,280x960 HD resolution -- two features we haven't found on many other first-gen Wi-Fi buzzers
The video feed and push alerts are responsive and the app is easy to navigate
cons: This smart buzzer has to be hard-wired and it isn't compatible with digital chimes or intercom systems (only mechanical chimes)
Its square shape won't fit on every door frame and its motion sensor and video storage features haven't launched yet

customer_reviews.title: Connectivity issues
customer_reviews.text: Not ready for prime time. After first one would not connect (Tried 3 different routers), returned and received replacement, second one would not connect either. I also have an august lock and august connect, both of which work fine and connect fine. The product is sleek and on the outside looks well designed. After many e-mails back and forth with their tech support, nothing ever resolved. Tech support stopped responding and my e-mails went to black hole. If they ever get this connectivity issue fixed, I would try again as I really like their design.
customer_reviews.author: John Ingram, Sr

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!!!!! ...
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!!!!!!!!! By the time the doorbell connects online, the person ringing the doorbell has already broken in, stolen your TV and jewelry and has had time to calmly walk away. I've been trying to work out the problems with August since October, with no luck. This product does not work. Their technical staff makes you reboot and re-set until your fingers are worn to the bone. What a joke!!!!! Just buy a Nest outdoor camera and be done with it. Cheaper, easier and it actually works. These people should be run out of town on a rail.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie S

customer_reviews.title: easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Works well, easy to install. Only giving a 4 because it is taking way too long to get the Apple HomeKit firmware update. It says HomeKit enabled and the hardware is but not the firmware. Update: Still no firmware updated to use with Apple Home Kit. Only response I get from August is as soon as the firmware gets certified by Apple. If I recall correctly, August came out and said Apple HomeKit enabled. Well the hardware is by the friggin firmware isn't. This is making me unhappy by the minute.
customer_reviews.author: Skip

customer_reviews.title: Sold a bill of goods
customer_reviews.text: After four different installation attempts, August technical support reminded me that this product does not work with digital chimes, only mechanical. 99% of the chimes sold on Amazon are digital and its hard to find a nice-sounding and looking mechanical chime. As a result I've had to replace my (20 year old) digital chime with a mechanical chime. The charging and pairing processes are also cumbersome. August has also still not released an update to allow homekit integration. It would be better to just get an outdoor camera and aim it at your entryway than to struggle to install this weak product.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kase

customer_reviews.title: By if you like wasting money on technology that doesn't work very well
customer_reviews.text: To start, the customer service is terrible and whether product is working or not doesn't matter that much if they have good customer service.::: August, it does not. My unit was having a problem and August didn't get back to me like they say they would At least five times in a row! I would have thrown in the trash if Amazon wasn't so generous in letting me return
customer_reviews.author: Everett Marc Photographer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last even 2 years
customer_reviews.text: This doorbell camera's motion features don't work very well, it required professional installation, and it has had many wifi issues. I'd avoid purchasing the 1st generation and honestly any doorbell cam that requires the August Connect as the connect has many issues with wifi signal dropping.
customer_reviews.author: FlyGuyDEN

customer_reviews.title: Technology just isn't there yet..:
customer_reviews.text: Frequently disconnects from wifi, awkward installation. Very laggy camera- often people have already left by the time I know that they're at the door and can get the camera to connect. Usually I see pictures of people's backs walking away
customer_reviews.author: Sandra D.

customer_reviews.title: it currently is simply a doorbell and the additional video/networking features are wasted. If you buy it
customer_reviews.text: After sending it in and returning it twice, it still will not power on. I changed out the doorbell transformer, still nothing. The doorbell is VERY picky about voltage, and since I don't have the time to spend hours messing with it, it currently is simply a doorbell and the additional video/networking features are wasted. If you buy it, have it professionally installed.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis from KY

customer_reviews.title: Poor wifi connection despite multiple efforts.
customer_reviews.text: Poor wifi connection. Low quality video. Erratic notifications. Had to return first one (good process for that aka no hassle in returning and getting new one covered under defective warranty) problem is the new one shipped direct from august still has poor connection. I moved router and purchased brand new AirPort Extreme. Wish they would put a better quality longer range antaenna in the next gen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: REBOOT---WAY TO MANY TIMES
customer_reviews.text: This product stinks. I should have bought Ring. I went with one because of how it looks---but it works like garbage. CONSTANTLY OFF LINE...even with the recommended WiFi extender (which was another $100). Have been in email contact with August support, and I keep being told to reboot.... so does that mean I have to reboot 6-10 times every day to make this work? And by the time I reboot----the person at the door is gone. HATE THIS ITEM---I emailed them for a refund and they said must go through the original purchase place--AMAZON---and now AMAZON doesn't take unopened items. So basically, up a river with no padded. SOOOOOO DISAPPOINTED IN THIS PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DIED in less than a year.
customer_reviews.text: Video was great. Audio had a noticeable static/hum sound in the background. Worked until about a month ago. It now shows a red screen and says error AV002 when you try to view live. Can't give more than two stars because of the audio issue and the lifespan.
customer_reviews.author: iPad3userinMA

customer_reviews.title: Very buggy
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this doorbell and August lock and connect for 1.5 years and it has been very buggy and less then satisfied. But since I have almost $400 invested into all this I have tried to work it out with tech support. Sometimes it'd help, but barley. I should have looked at a refund since I have had issues with it ever since I have owned it. Save your time and money and buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Nice, when working
customer_reviews.text: Only bought this item because I installed an August Smart Lock Deadbolt system and was let down when I realized it only had bluetooth capabilities and not wifi. Bought this camera to integrate the lock with wifi... couldn't connect to wifi with the stucco exterior walls so I bought a wifi extender and now I have a decent connection but still spotty. Camera does everything it is supposed to. Wouldn't really recommend as home security but very useful when used simply to monitor and lock/unlock remotely (with the deadbolt kit).
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas Blish

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money, but would like more integration.
customer_reviews.text: August's lack of integrations with so many other products, and the installation process are my two big beefs with this doorbell. However, you can't beat the price. I was able to get this used for around $35.
customer_reviews.author: jdl15

customer_reviews.title: We gave it a year and wish we had gone with Ring.
customer_reviews.text: We have had this for almost exactly 1 year now and while it is nice when it works. It rarely works as it should. We are now switching and calling this a loss and investing in Ring to see how we like that. Also, ring will work with Alexa and the August doorbell cam does not.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: WORST SMART DOORBELL
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to fully utilize August lock. Wifi connection is always down even with 1 gig router less than 5 feet away. Very sad they have no recalled all of these as they ALL have this issue. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew B.

customer_reviews.title: not reliable for the cost
customer_reviews.text: it doesnt kick on till after the people are so close you you cant make out a face and it films them walking away so its useless. for 300 i spent on the system.
customer_reviews.author: KEVIN GRIGGS

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME doorbell cam. Love it.
customer_reviews.text: This has been GREAT. Love this doorbell cam. The August doorbell cam setup is great. We get notifications all the time when someone shows up. This works perfectly for what we wanted it for. So far, I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product. I've been locked out because of the product not working more times than I care to count. Eventually had to uninstall it and throw this garbage away.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product, nothing but trouble for years
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 1 and had an issue, got another one and was never able to get it to connect. Had the deadbolt lock and works maybe 1/5 times, the keypad hardly works. I gave it time and a chance and just so frustrated with all the money I now wasted.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Good when it works
customer_reviews.text: Good when it works. Spent a ton of hours trying to make it work. Once it's working, there is little trouble, but once in a while it's slow to connect, or not connecting.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitriy Shevchenko

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product and awful customer service
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product and awful customer service. Seldomly sends notifications when the button is pressed, and when it does, the call doesn’t connect and/or video won’t play. Speaker sound is impossible to hear and distorted. Asked for a replacement after purchasing less than 45 days ago and was declined by supervisor. Do not purchase because AUGUST does not stand behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: HERMOSA BCH, CA

customer_reviews.title: Good but only if you have a mechanical doorbell
customer_reviews.text: Works great with other ifttt products plus it works as a bridge for the lock, I just don't like that it only works with mechanical doorbells, if you don't have one I suggest you buy ring.
customer_reviews.author: DMO

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Better than Skybell. However, first unit suffered water intrusion. August replaced unit for free, so top marks.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Me

customer_reviews.title: Lock is fine but the keypad
customer_reviews.text: I got door bell, lock, keypad, connect everything. DO NOT BUY! Door bell offline all the time and now, it cannot even connect to my wifi. And if you are outside US and Canada, do not even buy this, they cannot replace your device if it's damage or out of order. Lock is fine but the keypad.. super slow response, amazingly slow. You basically stand outside the door and wait for your luck. JUST DONT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: CHILAIHOWARD

customer_reviews.title: I had to return this - it just didn't fit ...
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this - it just didn't fit into the stucco wall of my house and I wasn't willing to have a contractor make it fit.
customer_reviews.author: joenet

customer_reviews.title: straight garbage. this company will obviously never figure this product ...
customer_reviews.text: straight garbage. this company will obviously never figure this product out. It is a great idea but it does not work. if you do get it to work it will fail eventually and no one will be able to fix it. Do not buy this product or any product from this company. They know their product is garbage and thats why they make it so hard to get customer support
customer_reviews.author: jerry hicks

customer_reviews.title: Total bummer
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited. I preordered it, waited, got it, installed it, and it worked for 1 minute. It required a reboot and hasn't connection to the wifi since. It says signal is too low when it's not.
customer_reviews.author: Maksum

customer_reviews.title: Not ready for PT
customer_reviews.text: Had to send back keep going dead its not ready for prime time stick to another doorbell
customer_reviews.author: Jfield

customer_reviews.title: Great potential, not quite there yet
customer_reviews.text: Product was very easy to install. Couple of drawbacks. For our installation it needed the angle block (included in package), but for some reason they didn't put the ability to attach the keypad with the angled block, requiring a separate place. The wi-fi signal near the cam is super strong (tested and verified), but it still takes a while to connect, and as other people mentioned, it is quicker to get up and answer the door than wait for your phone to connect (5-10 seconds average after the doorbell rings). And why does it not take a picture automatically when someone rings the doorbell? But it works and provides that remote capability. So A for effort, C for implementation....
customer_reviews.author: Bill in VA

customer_reviews.title: Shouldn't even be out in Beta for Android phones
customer_reviews.text: Wow, not ready for primetime by any means. Company must be run by engineers as the setup is a nightmare and the prompts while installing and connecting are less than helpful. My router went out so I got a "new" wifi network...all my other wifi dependent items connected to the new network within seconds; it's been 2 hours and I'm still getting the "Waiting for Doorbell" message in the app while trying to connect the doorbell to the network. And my August door lock, which worked fine before the new network, can no longer connect to the app on my phone because now it can't sync up using blue tooth. They say it's compatible with Android...don't believe them.
customer_reviews.author: A. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: very diificult to install if you live outside us with ...
customer_reviews.text: very diificult to install if you live outside us with a 220v doorbell chime. still not setup properly despide changing the chime to 16v and putting a transformer. the bell is getting very hot at 16v
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas

customer_reviews.title: Its OK, but could be better
customer_reviews.text: Camera doesn't support night vision, takes too long to load (maybe internet speed related). The 2-way audio is frustrating. Would be awesome if it came with an internal monitor and chime. No proper Apple Watch support. Looking forward to the September software upgrade. Easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not working
customer_reviews.text: This product is useless since i bought it does work it says cannot find the device when set it up
customer_reviews.author: Marlon

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Could not get it to stay connected, even with access point 10 feet away.
customer_reviews.author: OnlineShopper

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: when it works its great, but disconnects most often from my network.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Chettle

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy....
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for a year, called in to customer support a number of times, and it STILL has yet to work. I hate that I invested in the august lock system.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: I feel like I should have made a custom housing for one ...
customer_reviews.text: I feel like I should have made a custom housing for one of my old iPod Touch and write an custom app for it. it's not even compatible for my current doorbell system so I had to go buy a transformer for it and disconnect it from all my chimes. Seriously this device is very unreliable. I have a gigabit fiber optic internet connection and it's downloading at 14mbps at 59dBm of 60dBm signal strength. and the upload is at best 5.xxMbps so far. Tthe parts they use is crap and the software isn't that great at all. It's nice when it works but I have to reset the machine whenever I cannot connect to it.
customer_reviews.author: Sangmin Lee

customer_reviews.title: Won't connect to internet even next to router. Spoke ...
customer_reviews.text: Won't connect to internet even next to router. Spoke with August support and they couldn't get it to work either. Speed test of both upload and download speed were well above their specs. It just didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: CO Brown

customer_reviews.title: Checkout August website before you purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Saw this advertised, and purchased it. I should have checked out their website first, because it states that it can only be used with a mechanical doorbell. Mine is digital, so I had to return the door cam.
customer_reviews.author: dnh3155

customer_reviews.title: Good clarity but it takes a while to trigger the ...
customer_reviews.text: Good clarity but it takes a while to trigger the automatic camera to start recording. I can't find a way to adjust it. Very sensitive too.
customer_reviews.author: Leisa H.

customer_reviews.title: Tech support is great but product needs new firmware
customer_reviews.text: Camera fails even after exchange. Tech support is great but product needs new firmware.
customer_reviews.author: John Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Won't connect to my wi-fi
customer_reviews.text: I tried this device after trying the Ring doorbell. However, I couldn't get ot to connect. Ring wins.
customer_reviews.author: K Wright

customer_reviews.title: Dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived dead on arrival. Return date passed! Didn't install it for a month - ugh.
customer_reviews.author: Arjun G.

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: The installation was not working no matter what technical support tried.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro P.

customer_reviews.title: Best smart doorbell in market
customer_reviews.text: Please note that this is product in development. And they keep improving software. Motion detection works very well. Notifications are still not always in real time on Android, but that is nature of push notifications. Recording based on motion detection works very well. And even if photo is not clear that I got with push notification, stored video (promotional feature, paid for in future) clears it up. I would be paying for that.
customer_reviews.author: Srdjan Pantic

customer_reviews.title: STAY CLEAR OF THIS PRODUCT. DO NOT BUY IT.
customer_reviews.text: STAY CLEAR OF THIS PRODUCT. It will not work with any type of digital chime and August does not make this fact public. Digital chime?? It's the type installed in most homes today. It will only work with mechanical chimes and it does not do that very reliably. SkyBell is a much better product and all the necessary adapters are available to make it work seamlessly with digital and mechanical chimes. I have a chain of emails between myself and August technical support that document my frustration with the product. Bottom line, save yourself the hassle by just staying clear of All August products.
customer_reviews.author: Mpatt777

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: I have other August products.....been trying to set the doorbell up for 2 hours......i get to the point where it wants to update the firmware and it gets stuck at 19%...have called August support twice and BOTH times i was cut off without a return call.....pretty bad... terrible..........
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan E. Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Deceptively easy and worked for a while - then everything quit ...
customer_reviews.text: Deceptively easy and worked for a while - then everything quit working. All four August products were in use and interconnected and they all stopped functioning - in the most frustrating way. August documentation is misleading and poor.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: could be better. keeps losing wifi signal
customer_reviews.text: could be better. keeps losing wifi signal. even though i have 2 routers with great strength and super duper fast internet speed.
customer_reviews.author: caterina mascolo

customer_reviews.title: Great security.
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift for my son in law, he just put it up. So far far he is happy with it. Now he can see who was or is at the door from his iPhone from wherever he is, out of town, across town or at home in the basement.
customer_reviews.author: Nina Coy

customer_reviews.title: The Doorbell Camera is horrible. I have the lock and the remote keypad
customer_reviews.text: The Doorbell Camera is horrible. I have the lock and the remote keypad, and they work great, but the camera has some serious issues. After spending over an hour on the phone with technical support, I uninstalled it and installed a Ring doorbell.
customer_reviews.author: james h nye

customer_reviews.title: Pre-release firmware required
customer_reviews.text: This thing was kind of a piece when I installed it. I have a current generation AirPort Extreme and Google Fiber, so wireless performance and speed are two things I never have to worry about. The doorbell would never connect when I would attempt to answer the door, or would throw an error. I finally contacted support a month later and they remotely installed pre-release firmware on my device. Ever since then, the doorbell has performed flawlessly. It connects fast and reliably, and the video quality is stunning. Now I'm just waiting for the motion detection update and I'll be one very happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great integration with my locks
customer_reviews.text: Great integration with my locks. I like the video quality but audio could be better and motion detection had to be set to 20% because every passing car was noticed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: he thinks it is a quality doorbell which can be operated through the smart phone.
customer_reviews.text: Really don't know hos this works yet as it has not been installed. Purchased it for my son...he thinks it is a quality doorbell which can be operated through the smart phone.
customer_reviews.author: Janieb

product_meta.title: August Doorbell Camera, 1st generation - Dark Gray
product_meta.description: Always know who's at the front door, even when you're not home. August doorbell cam alerts you every time the bell is rung and lets you see and speak with visitors from your smartphone, from anywhere. One-way HD camera gives you a clear view of visitors while ensuring your privacy. Easy to install, replaces your existing doorbell.
feature_bullets: See and speak with visitors at your door with your smartphone.Connects to your existing analog wired doorbell and uses existing house current (16-24v).
Secure your home. Always know who is at the front door with live HD video.
Stay Aware. With motion detection, get instant alerts when there's activity at your doorstep.
Speak with visitors even when you are not home.
Replay video of missed visitors with optional cloud recording.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 2.6 out of 5 stars143 ratings2.6 out of 5 stars
